text: Valegro (born 5 July 2002) is a dressage horse ridden by the British equestrian Charlotte Dujardin. His stable name is Blueberry. He is a double World Champion in dressage. Valegro has won the Grand Prix Special and Grand Prix Freestyle. == Career == Valegro had not lost a race since January 2012. Dujardin and Valegro won the FEI World Cup grand prix at London Olympia in 2011. They set a world record. Their score was 88.022% in April 2012. Dujardin and Valegro were for Great Britain in the 2012 Summer Olympics. They set a new Olympic score of 83.784%. On August 7, 2012, Dujardin and Valegro were a part of a team that won the gold medal in the team dressage. They won a gold medal in individual dressage. At the 2013 European Championships in Herning, Charlotte and Valegro won the Grand Prix and the Grand Prix Special. Valegro got a gold medal in the individual dressage at the Rio 2016 Olympic Games. == Retirement == On 14 December 2016, Valegro was retired by Dujardin. Dujardin and Valegro did a goodbye speech at the London International Horse Show 2016.
